item.title: RAID Monitor for LSI/3Ware MegaRAID controllers
item.description: I still manage a few old servers with 3Ware/LSI MegaRAID controllers (e.g. the 9650SE) and wrote the following Python3 script which is sitting in /etc/cron.daily and sends and email if there is any problem with the battery, disks or units. Keep in mind that scripts inside the /etc/cron.* folders are not allowed to have a dot in the filename, otherwise those will be ignored. If you don’t have a working mail configuration, I recommend exim4 which is easily set up in a few minutes with standard settings.

item.title: pip update-all
item.description: Problem to solve Update all packages which are managed by pip. Fix pip list --outdated --format=freeze | grep -v '^\-e' | cut -d = -f 1 | xargs -n1 pip install -U Alternatively pip freeze|grep '=='|awk -F= '{print $1}' | xargs pip install -U
